thread.title: High school roundup: Schuylerville girls' soccer blanks Mechanicville
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Schuylerville girls' soccer blanks Mechanicville - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Schuylerville girls' soccer blanks Mechanicville
text:
Schuylerville climbed to 11-1 in the Wasaren League with a 3-0 shutout victory over visiting Mechanicville on Saturday in a girls' soccer contest at Schuylerville.
Kaitlyn Congdon , Kaleigh Gale and Maddy Nevins each scored goals for the Black Horses, who moved to 11-3 overall with the win.
More girls' soccer: Sally Holden scored two goals to lead Averill Park past Queensbury, 2-0, in a non-league game at Averill Park. Claire Millington stopped three shots to earn the shutout win in goal for the Warriors. ... Theresa Stinson and Abby Burns had goals to help Troy pick up a 2-0 victory over Tamarac in another non-league contest. Carlee Lockrow and Eliza Stewart chipped in with assists and Maddie Pinzer had nine saves to get the shutout victory for the Flying Horses. Sarah Gibbs made 19 saves to lead Tamarac. ... Lauryn Krupa scored two second-half goals to lift Maple Hill over Mekeel Christian, 2-0, at Maple Hill.
Boys' soccer: Quinn Smith had two goals and an assist in a 5-1 Galway victory over Berlin at the Maple Hill Tournament. Quinn and teammate Taylor Hartman scored goals in the game's first 10 minutes to seal the win for the Golden Eagles. Connor Bradshaw and Emmanuel Diaz also had goals for Galway. Ryan Willis scored the lone Berlin goal.
Cross country: The Saratoga Springs boys' and girls' teams each took first place at the Tartan Invitational meet in Scotia on Saturday. The Blue Streaks boys' team took first with 20 points, ahead of second-place Holland Patent (70 points) and third-place Scotia (75 points). Saratoga's Aidan Waite was first individually, finishing with a time of 17 minutes, 1.22 seconds. Blue Streaks teammates Geoff Howles (17:04.34) and Will Howe (17:13.62) were second and third, repsectively. On the girls' side, Saratoga topped the field with 27 points. Essex was second with 59 points, and Schuylerville finished third with 97 points. Ciara Knott of Saratoga Springs was first with a time of 19:12.81. Emma Farrington of Essex was second with a 19:24.28, and Olivia Lazarou of Amsterdam was third.
